Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Internship - Software Engineer - Platform

Part time paid job for students with starting day June 1st, 2023 and further.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the Platform team at Oracle-NetSuite in Brno. The platform at NetSuite allows developers, partners and customers to build powerful solutions on top of the core NetSuite system. It supports a wide-variety of features, such as allowing to build a custom data model, to add business logic through custom scripts, to create complex workflows, access model, integrations and many others. You would be working on building and enhancing this highly complex and critical system, with particular focus on clean design of architecture, data structures and APIs. The extraordinary expressive power of platform needs high speed of execution, so coming up with fast algorithms and efficient designs is critical for its (and our) success.

Description:
We’re looking for an energetic, skilled data engineer to join our team and work with us on our marketing solutions platform. You will play an important role in the development of the new ScanmarQED cloud-based data platform, develop scalable applications and work side-by-side with the team to create new solutions, test your own ideas and share your knowledge.
You will report to the Data Engineering lead, and support the team by working from our office in Prague (CZ) or our office in Houten (NL). We are looking for an individual who would describe themselves as someone who loves working with the latest technologies, is capable of abstract thinking and has good problem solving and communication skills. If you can create tools that enable the business to achieve the next growth stage and you get energized by doing this, we would like you to be part of our team!

Description:
Application Engineer - suitable for graduates
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a new addition to our Robotics Division to expand our existing team as an Application Engineer. Your task will be to implement robotic workplace projects in various industries. Our customers are in all sectors but predominantly Automotive Tier 1. Our projects are from installation to handover and are mainly abroad, in countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Russia or Israel and occasionally the Czech Republic. You can spend up to 6 months a year on these projects in total, so it's more for someone who enjoys travelling and wants to see the world. This position is suitable for experienced PLC programmers or application engineers, as well as electrical graduates who are interested in robotics and like to travel. Once you start, you don't work on projects alone, but always with more experienced colleagues to get a good grounding. For more information about our robotics division in the country, click on the link below: https://new.abb.com/products/robotics/cs Will you join us?

Description:
Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences, and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?

Description
Azul == Java. As the only company focused 100% on Java, Azul is building the Java platform for the modern cloud enterprise. Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Description:
Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Relocation Assistance Offered Within Region
# 152230 - Hustopece, Jihomoravský kraj, Czech Republic
Job Summary:
The Technical Systems Manager is responsible for a) the coordination of the equipment & buildings project implementation b) the oversight of the Maintenance and Electrical/Control departments c) supervision of the Packaging Engineering d) initiating & driving CI-activities at all areas of his responsibility.
He/She stays abreast of plant performance trends versus major KPI goals and leverages all resources from the respective departments, as well as by CI (Continuous Improvement)-activities that improve plant performance and/or to derive need for , & content of, future capital program. He/She develops and manages the overall plant capital budget and the plant maintenance budget. He/She must ensure successful execution of the plant capital program which can include multiple projects with varying scope, timelines and capital expenditures. In parallel he/she has to ensure effective execution of the Planned Maintenance program. The Technical Systems Manager will also ensure that all engineering aspects of projects as well as associated documentation are in compliance with local, Colgate/Hill’s, legal and EOHS regulations.

SENIOR QUALITY ENGINEER

nastavování a udržování kvalitativních procesů u stávajících a nových projektů

Internship/SW Developer - part time-230000XP

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Internship - Software Engineer - Platform

Part time paid job for students with starting day June 1st, 2023 and further.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the Platform team at Oracle-NetSuite in Brno. The platform at NetSuite allows developers, partners and customers to build powerful solutions on top of the core NetSuite system. It supports a wide-variety of features, such as allowing to build a custom data model, to add business logic through custom scripts, to create complex workflows, access model, integrations and many others. You would be working on building and enhancing this highly complex and critical system, with particular focus on clean design of architecture, data structures and APIs. The extraordinary expressive power of platform needs high speed of execution, so coming up with fast algorithms and efficient designs is critical for its (and our) success.

Description:
We’re looking for an energetic, skilled data engineer to join our team and work with us on our marketing solutions platform. You will play an important role in the development of the new ScanmarQED cloud-based data platform, develop scalable applications and work side-by-side with the team to create new solutions, test your own ideas and share your knowledge.
You will report to the Data Engineering lead, and support the team by working from our office in Prague (CZ) or our office in Houten (NL). We are looking for an individual who would describe themselves as someone who loves working with the latest technologies, is capable of abstract thinking and has good problem solving and communication skills. If you can create tools that enable the business to achieve the next growth stage and you get energized by doing this, we would like you to be part of our team!

Description:
Application Engineer - suitable for graduates
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a new addition to our Robotics Division to expand our existing team as an Application Engineer. Your task will be to implement robotic workplace projects in various industries. Our customers are in all sectors but predominantly Automotive Tier 1. Our projects are from installation to handover and are mainly abroad, in countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Russia or Israel and occasionally the Czech Republic. You can spend up to 6 months a year on these projects in total, so it's more for someone who enjoys travelling and wants to see the world. This position is suitable for experienced PLC programmers or application engineers, as well as electrical graduates who are interested in robotics and like to travel. Once you start, you don't work on projects alone, but always with more experienced colleagues to get a good grounding. For more information about our robotics division in the country, click on the link below: https://new.abb.com/products/robotics/cs Will you join us?

Description:
Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences, and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Description:
Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Relocation Assistance Offered Within Region
# 152230 - Hustopece, Jihomoravský kraj, Czech Republic
Job Summary:
The Technical Systems Manager is responsible for a) the coordination of the equipment & buildings project implementation b) the oversight of the Maintenance and Electrical/Control departments c) supervision of the Packaging Engineering d) initiating & driving CI-activities at all areas of his responsibility.
He/She stays abreast of plant performance trends versus major KPI goals and leverages all resources from the respective departments, as well as by CI (Continuous Improvement)-activities that improve plant performance and/or to derive need for , & content of, future capital program. He/She develops and manages the overall plant capital budget and the plant maintenance budget. He/She must ensure successful execution of the plant capital program which can include multiple projects with varying scope, timelines and capital expenditures. In parallel he/she has to ensure effective execution of the Planned Maintenance program. The Technical Systems Manager will also ensure that all engineering aspects of projects as well as associated documentation are in compliance with local, Colgate/Hill’s, legal and EOHS regulations.

Description:
Internship/SW Developer - part time-230000XP

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Internship - Software Engineer - Platform

Part time paid job for students with starting day June 1st, 2023 and further.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the Platform team at Oracle-NetSuite in Brno. The platform at NetSuite allows developers, partners and customers to build powerful solutions on top of the core NetSuite system. It supports a wide-variety of features, such as allowing to build a custom data model, to add business logic through custom scripts, to create complex workflows, access model, integrations and many others. You would be working on building and enhancing this highly complex and critical system, with particular focus on clean design of architecture, data structures and APIs. The extraordinary expressive power of platform needs high speed of execution, so coming up with fast algorithms and efficient designs is critical for its (and our) success.

Description:
O nás
Rozšiřujeme náš stávající tým a potřebujeme možná právě Vás. Jsme významná výrobní společnost, přední dodavatel v automobilovém průmyslu. Pracujeme s nejmodernějšími technologiemi, nabízíme kromě zajímavé práce vyspělou firemní kulturu a mezinárodní přátelské prostředí.
Do závodu v TRUTNOVĚ hledáme zkušeného kandidáta /kandidátku na pozici:
TECHNOLOG /INDUSTRIAL ENGINEER
Náplň práce:

We’re looking for an energetic, skilled data engineer to join our team and work with us on our marketing solutions platform. You will play an important role in the development of the new ScanmarQED cloud-based data platform, develop scalable applications and work side-by-side with the team to create new solutions, test your own ideas and share your knowledge.
You will report to the Data Engineering lead, and support the team by working from our office in Prague (CZ) or our office in Houten (NL). We are looking for an individual who would describe themselves as someone who loves working with the latest technologies, is capable of abstract thinking and has good problem solving and communication skills. If you can create tools that enable the business to achieve the next growth stage and you get energized by doing this, we would like you to be part of our team!

Company Description

We Dream. We Do. We Deliver.
As a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation, we partner with Top 500 companies in the DACH region and in Eastern Europe.
Our 1200+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built, through providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, Mobile, Social Media, Intranet and CMS. We are part of the global Merkle brand, the largest brand within the dentsu group, who shares with us a network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.
Are you ready to push the boundaries of digital change and join a growing team with an amazing work environment?

Description:
Application Engineer - suitable for graduates
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a new addition to our Robotics Division to expand our existing team as an Application Engineer. Your task will be to implement robotic workplace projects in various industries. Our customers are in all sectors but predominantly Automotive Tier 1. Our projects are from installation to handover and are mainly abroad, in countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Russia or Israel and occasionally the Czech Republic. You can spend up to 6 months a year on these projects in total, so it's more for someone who enjoys travelling and wants to see the world. This position is suitable for experienced PLC programmers or application engineers, as well as electrical graduates who are interested in robotics and like to travel. Once you start, you don't work on projects alone, but always with more experienced colleagues to get a good grounding. For more information about our robotics division in the country, click on the link below: https://new.abb.com/products/robotics/cs Will you join us?

Description:
Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences, and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Job_title: Global Support Engineer – Mobile Data Network Czechia
Description:
Job Description
Our client is a global provider of intelligent mobile Internet solutions that enable operators to improve quality, reduce network operational expenses, and manage and monetize the mobile Internet.

Requirements:
 Experience with customer-facing activities in an international environment
 Knowledgeable in customer support processes, tooling, and troubleshooting

Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Relocation Assistance Offered Within Region
# 152230 - Hustopece, Jihomoravský kraj, Czech Republic
Job Summary:
The Technical Systems Manager is responsible for a) the coordination of the equipment & buildings project implementation b) the oversight of the Maintenance and Electrical/Control departments c) supervision of the Packaging Engineering d) initiating & driving CI-activities at all areas of his responsibility.
He/She stays abreast of plant performance trends versus major KPI goals and leverages all resources from the respective departments, as well as by CI (Continuous Improvement)-activities that improve plant performance and/or to derive need for , & content of, future capital program. He/She develops and manages the overall plant capital budget and the plant maintenance budget. He/She must ensure successful execution of the plant capital program which can include multiple projects with varying scope, timelines and capital expenditures. In parallel he/she has to ensure effective execution of the Planned Maintenance program. The Technical Systems Manager will also ensure that all engineering aspects of projects as well as associated documentation are in compliance with local, Colgate/Hill’s, legal and EOHS regulations.

Description:
Internship/SW Developer - part time-230000XP

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Internship - Software Engineer - Platform

Part time paid job for students with starting day June 1st, 2023 and further.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the Platform team at Oracle-NetSuite in Brno. The platform at NetSuite allows developers, partners and customers to build powerful solutions on top of the core NetSuite system. It supports a wide-variety of features, such as allowing to build a custom data model, to add business logic through custom scripts, to create complex workflows, access model, integrations and many others. You would be working on building and enhancing this highly complex and critical system, with particular focus on clean design of architecture, data structures and APIs. The extraordinary expressive power of platform needs high speed of execution, so coming up with fast algorithms and efficient designs is critical for its (and our) success.

Description:
We’re looking for an energetic, skilled data engineer to join our team and work with us on our marketing solutions platform. You will play an important role in the development of the new ScanmarQED cloud-based data platform, develop scalable applications and work side-by-side with the team to create new solutions, test your own ideas and share your knowledge.
You will report to the Data Engineering lead, and support the team by working from our office in Prague (CZ) or our office in Houten (NL). We are looking for an individual who would describe themselves as someone who loves working with the latest technologies, is capable of abstract thinking and has good problem solving and communication skills. If you can create tools that enable the business to achieve the next growth stage and you get energized by doing this, we would like you to be part of our team!

Company Description

We Dream. We Do. We Deliver.
As a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation, we partner with Top 500 companies in the DACH region and in Eastern Europe.
Our 1200+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built, through providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, Mobile, Social Media, Intranet and CMS. We are part of the global Merkle brand, the largest brand within the dentsu group, who shares with us a network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.
Are you ready to push the boundaries of digital change and join a growing team with an amazing work environment?

Description:
Application Engineer - suitable for graduates
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a new addition to our Robotics Division to expand our existing team as an Application Engineer. Your task will be to implement robotic workplace projects in various industries. Our customers are in all sectors but predominantly Automotive Tier 1. Our projects are from installation to handover and are mainly abroad, in countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Russia or Israel and occasionally the Czech Republic. You can spend up to 6 months a year on these projects in total, so it's more for someone who enjoys travelling and wants to see the world. This position is suitable for experienced PLC programmers or application engineers, as well as electrical graduates who are interested in robotics and like to travel. Once you start, you don't work on projects alone, but always with more experienced colleagues to get a good grounding. For more information about our robotics division in the country, click on the link below: https://new.abb.com/products/robotics/cs Will you join us?

Description:
Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences, and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Description:
Valeo is a tech global company, designing breakthrough solutions to reinvent the mobility. We are an automotive supplier partner to automakers and new mobility actors worldwide. Our vision? Invent a greener and more secured mobility, thanks to solutions focusing on intuitive driving and reducing CO2 emissions. We are leader on our businesses, and recognized as one of the largest global innovative companies.
We are an automotive supplier, a partner to all automakers worldwide. As a technological company, we design innovative products and systems that contribute to reduction of CO2 emissions and to development of automated driving. In our Research and Development center in Prague we employ seven hundred engineers. They are those who stand behind the latest systems of active safety (ADAS) and autonomous driving. What does it mean? Software, hardware engineers, together with mechanical designers, test and system engineers develop sensors and systems for safe and comfortable driving. Automated parking systems, automated emergency braking, blind spot detection and road sign recognition are just a few examples.

Description:
Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Relocation Assistance Offered Within Region
# 152230 - Hustopece, Jihomoravský kraj, Czech Republic
Job Summary:
The Technical Systems Manager is responsible for a) the coordination of the equipment & buildings project implementation b) the oversight of the Maintenance and Electrical/Control departments c) supervision of the Packaging Engineering d) initiating & driving CI-activities at all areas of his responsibility.
He/She stays abreast of plant performance trends versus major KPI goals and leverages all resources from the respective departments, as well as by CI (Continuous Improvement)-activities that improve plant performance and/or to derive need for , & content of, future capital program. He/She develops and manages the overall plant capital budget and the plant maintenance budget. He/She must ensure successful execution of the plant capital program which can include multiple projects with varying scope, timelines and capital expenditures. In parallel he/she has to ensure effective execution of the Planned Maintenance program. The Technical Systems Manager will also ensure that all engineering aspects of projects as well as associated documentation are in compliance with local, Colgate/Hill’s, legal and EOHS regulations.

Description:
Internship/SW Developer - part time-230000XP

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Internship - Software Engineer - Platform

Part time paid job for students with starting day June 1st, 2023 and further.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the Platform team at Oracle-NetSuite in Brno. The platform at NetSuite allows developers, partners and customers to build powerful solutions on top of the core NetSuite system. It supports a wide-variety of features, such as allowing to build a custom data model, to add business logic through custom scripts, to create complex workflows, access model, integrations and many others. You would be working on building and enhancing this highly complex and critical system, with particular focus on clean design of architecture, data structures and APIs. The extraordinary expressive power of platform needs high speed of execution, so coming up with fast algorithms and efficient designs is critical for its (and our) success.

Description:
We’re looking for an energetic, skilled data engineer to join our team and work with us on our marketing solutions platform. You will play an important role in the development of the new ScanmarQED cloud-based data platform, develop scalable applications and work side-by-side with the team to create new solutions, test your own ideas and share your knowledge.
You will report to the Data Engineering lead, and support the team by working from our office in Prague (CZ) or our office in Houten (NL). We are looking for an individual who would describe themselves as someone who loves working with the latest technologies, is capable of abstract thinking and has good problem solving and communication skills. If you can create tools that enable the business to achieve the next growth stage and you get energized by doing this, we would like you to be part of our team!

Company Description

We Dream. We Do. We Deliver.
As a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation, we partner with Top 500 companies in the DACH region and in Eastern Europe.
Our 1200+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built, through providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, Mobile, Social Media, Intranet and CMS. We are part of the global Merkle brand, the largest brand within the dentsu group, who shares with us a network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.
Are you ready to push the boundaries of digital change and join a growing team with an amazing work environment?

Description:
Application Engineer - suitable for graduates
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a new addition to our Robotics Division to expand our existing team as an Application Engineer. Your task will be to implement robotic workplace projects in various industries. Our customers are in all sectors but predominantly Automotive Tier 1. Our projects are from installation to handover and are mainly abroad, in countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Russia or Israel and occasionally the Czech Republic. You can spend up to 6 months a year on these projects in total, so it's more for someone who enjoys travelling and wants to see the world. This position is suitable for experienced PLC programmers or application engineers, as well as electrical graduates who are interested in robotics and like to travel. Once you start, you don't work on projects alone, but always with more experienced colleagues to get a good grounding. For more information about our robotics division in the country, click on the link below: https://new.abb.com/products/robotics/cs Will you join us?

Description:
Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences, and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.

Description:
Cloud Services Engineer
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency - monitoring the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
EUMETSAT opened a portfolio of cloud-based big data services in 2020 to bring users to its data. The portfolio is based on advanced architectures, applications, user portals and hosted processing capabilities with full integration across the entire cloud stack from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) up to Data as a Service (DaaS). EUMETSAT has a key role in several cloud-based international initiatives such as DIAS, WekEO, European Weather Cloud (EWC) and Destination Earth.
Within the Competence Area of Cloud Services in the Digital Solutions and SAF Division (DSA), the Cloud Services Engineer will be the main technical focal point for all cloud services and solutions developed by DSA that have a focus on downstream applications. The postholder will manage the engineering, evolution and maintenance of those cloud services, including procurement and management of industrial support and services needed for their development, implementation, evolution and achieving the targeted service levels

Description:
Relocation Assistance Offered Within Region
# 152230 - Hustopece, Jihomoravský kraj, Czech Republic
Job Summary:
The Technical Systems Manager is responsible for a) the coordination of the equipment & buildings project implementation b) the oversight of the Maintenance and Electrical/Control departments c) supervision of the Packaging Engineering d) initiating & driving CI-activities at all areas of his responsibility.
He/She stays abreast of plant performance trends versus major KPI goals and leverages all resources from the respective departments, as well as by CI (Continuous Improvement)-activities that improve plant performance and/or to derive need for , & content of, future capital program. He/She develops and manages the overall plant capital budget and the plant maintenance budget. He/She must ensure successful execution of the plant capital program which can include multiple projects with varying scope, timelines and capital expenditures. In parallel he/she has to ensure effective execution of the Planned Maintenance program. The Technical Systems Manager will also ensure that all engineering aspects of projects as well as associated documentation are in compliance with local, Colgate/Hill’s, legal and EOHS regulations.

Description:

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Internship - Software Engineer - Platform

Part time paid job for students with starting day June 1st, 2023 and further.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the Platform team at Oracle-NetSuite in Brno. The platform at NetSuite allows developers, partners and customers to build powerful solutions on top of the core NetSuite system. It supports a wide-variety of features, such as allowing to build a custom data model, to add business logic through custom scripts, to create complex workflows, access model, integrations and many others. You would be working on building and enhancing this highly complex and critical system, with particular focus on clean design of architecture, data structures and APIs. The extraordinary expressive power of platform needs high speed of execution, so coming up with fast algorithms and efficient designs is critical for its (and our) success.

Description:
Application Engineer - suitable for graduates
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a new addition to our Robotics Division to expand our existing team as an Application Engineer. Your task will be to implement robotic workplace projects in various industries. Our customers are in all sectors but predominantly Automotive Tier 1. Our projects are from installation to handover and are mainly abroad, in countries like Spain, France, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Russia or Israel and occasionally the Czech Republic. You can spend up to 6 months a year on these projects in total, so it's more for someone who enjoys travelling and wants to see the world. This position is suitable for experienced PLC programmers or application engineers, as well as electrical graduates who are interested in robotics and like to travel. Once you start, you don't work on projects alone, but always with more experienced colleagues to get a good grounding. For more information about our robotics division in the country, click on the link below: https://new.abb.com/products/robotics/cs Will you join us?

Description:
We’re looking for an energetic, skilled data engineer to join our team and work with us on our marketing solutions platform. You will play an important role in the development of the new ScanmarQED cloud-based data platform, develop scalable applications and work side-by-side with the team to create new solutions, test your own ideas and share your knowledge.
You will report to the Data Engineering lead, and support the team by working from our office in Prague (CZ) or our office in Houten (NL). We are looking for an individual who would describe themselves as someone who loves working with the latest technologies, is capable of abstract thinking and has good problem solving and communication skills. If you can create tools that enable the business to achieve the next growth stage and you get energized by doing this, we would like you to be part of our team!

O nás
Rozšiřujeme náš stávající tým a potřebujeme možná právě Vás. Jsme významná výrobní společnost, přední dodavatel v automobilovém průmyslu. Pracujeme s nejmodernějšími technologiemi, nabízíme kromě zajímavé práce vyspělou firemní kulturu a mezinárodní přátelské prostředí.
Do závodu v TRUTNOVĚ hledáme zkušeného kandidáta /kandidátku na pozici:
TECHNOLOG /INDUSTRIAL ENGINEER
Náplň práce:

Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences, and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and building technology for democratization of Data Centers. Help us build the #1 bare metal cloud system, and work with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical!
The Ubuntu MAAS team is responsible for delivering our Metal As A Service hyperscale provisioning technology. Ubuntu strives to be the most scalable, cloud ready server distribution and MAAS is our platform to get it there. MAAS is a rapidly evolving software stack written in Python and Go, and we are looking for experienced software engineers who understand performance at scale, networking, storage and usability.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of Ubuntu and be able to show technical leadership with a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. This position requires international travel several times a year.
